result.execSummary:
This case or charge(s) on this case have been reopened. After a case has been completed, the case or charge(s) can be reopened for a variety of reasons. The WCCA case record and court record events must be reviewed to determine the exact reasons that the case or charge(s) were reopened.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs.**NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
---------------------------------

The defendant is a participant in the Walworth county Drug Court Program and must comply with all the rules and regulations of the Program with no violations.
Upon successful completion of probation, the conviction will be vacated and dismissed.
Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
---------------------------------

timeConds.notes: As a condition of probation the defendant must serve five (5) days in the Walworth County Jail without Work Release to commence immediately after sentencing. The Court STAYS one year of  conditional jail time to be used at Court's discretion.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gerald A Bartelt Jr.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Gerald A Bartelt not in court.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court in session @ 3:52 p.m. Appearance made. Matter before the Court for the State to make a record as to graduation ceremony, and State's motion to reopen and vacate conviction based upon successful completion of the Drug Court Treatment Program. Court grants State's motion. Case to be reopened and conviction vacated.
Court in recess @ 3:53 pm.
Defendant Gerald A Bartelt appeared.  Treatment Court Hearing scheduled for December 22, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Discharge of Probation Case #15CF190; Successful completion of Drug Court
